provisions.title: Section 2
provisions.content:
2. The maximum number of game birds which may be hunted by any one
person, on any one day, during a shooting season is-
     (a) where the only game bird being hunted is the Bald-pate-
            (i) on a Saturday, fifteen during each period from sunrise to
                9:00 a.m. and fiom 2:30 p.m. to sunset; and
            (ii) fifteen on a Sunday during the period fiom sunrise to 9:00
                 a.m.;
     (6) where the only game bird being hunted is the Mourning Dove or
         White-winged Dove or the Pea Dove-
            (i) on a Saturday, twenty during each period from sunrise to
                9:00 a.m. and fiom 2:30 p.m. to sunset; and
            (ii) twenty on a Sunday during the period from sunrise to 9:00
                 a.m.;
     (c) where the game birds being hunted are-
             (i) the Mourning Dove and White-winged Dove;
            (ii) the Mourning Dove and Pea Dove; or
            (iii) the Pea Dove and White-winged Dove,
         twenty during each period fiom sunrise to 9:OOa.m. and fiom 2:30
         p.m. to sunset on a Saturday, and from sunrise to 9:00 a.m. on a
         Sunday; and

         which may be hunted during any one period shall be fifteen.

provisions.title: Section 3
provisions.content:
3. Any person who contravenes the provisions of these Regulations
shall be liable to a fine not exceeding fifty dollars or in default of
payment thereof to imprisonment with hard labour for a period not
exceeding three months.

provisions.content:

appropriate authority may, subject to paragraph (lA), on production of a

provisions.title: Section 5A
provisions.content:
5A.--(I) Every hunter's licence shall be subject to such conditions as the
appropriate authority may determine or specify in the licence and may be
suspended or revoked by the appropriate authority for breach of any such
conditions or for breach of the provisions of the Act or regulations made
thereunder and a licence suspended as aforesaid shall during the period of
suspension be of no effect.
          (2) Before the appropriate authority revokes or suspends any
hunter's licence he shall give the licensee notice in writing of his intention to
do so andfirequirethe licensee within such time as may be specified in the
notice to show cause why the licence should not be revoked or suspended, as
the case may be.
          (3) Where-
      (a) a licensee fails to comply with a requirement pursuant to paragraph
          ( 1 ) to show cause within the time specified in the notice or if the
          cause shown is inadequate in the opinion of the appropriate
          authority; or
       (6) after due enquiry by the appropriate authority in respect of any
           allegation made against the li$ensee and after giving the licensee
           an opportunity to make representations, the appropriate authority is
           satisfied that the nature of the facts established consequent on the
           enquiry is seriously detrimental to wild life,
the' appropride authority may, by ?otice in writing to the licensee,
suspend' the ',licence for such period as the appropriate -authority
may coiisider necessary or desirable, or, as the case may be, revoke the

provisions.title: Section 5B
provisions.content:
5B. Any person aggrieved by a decision of the appropriate authority
to revoke or suspend a licence shall, within fifteen days of the
receipt of the notice under paragraph (2) of regulation SA appeal in
writing to the Minister.

provisions.title: Section 6
provisions.content:
6. Every person who fails to carry a hunter's licence, for the time
being in force, on or about his person when in the wurse of hunting
any game bird, shall be guilty of an offence and liable on summary
conviction thereof before a Resident Magistrate to a fine not exceeding
one hundred thousand dollars and in default of payment thereof to
imprisonment with hard labour for a period not exceeding three months.

provisions.title: Section 7
provisions.content:
7. Every person who, without reasonable excuse (the proof whereof
shall lie upon him), fails to produce to any Game Warden a valid
hunter's licence in relation to the said person, upon being reasonably
required by the Game Warden so to do, shall be guilty of an offence
and liable on summary conviction thereof before a Resident Magistrate
to a fine not exceeding one hundred thousand dollars and in default of
payment thereof to imprisonment with hard labour for a period nolt
 exceeding three months.
